casebody.data:
William H. Kidston, Appellee, v. The Massillon Iron & Steel Company, Appellant.Gen. No. 23,167. (Not to be reported in full.)Appeal from the Superior Court of Cook county; the Hon. Oscab E. Heard, Judge, presiding.Heard in the Branch Appellate Court at the March term, 1917.Affirmed.Opinion filed March 12, 1918.

Statement of the Case.

Action of trover by William H. Kidston, plaintiff, against the Massillon Iron & Steel Company, a corporation, defendant, for the conversion of corporate stock. From a judgment for plaintiff for $30,851, defendant appeals. The decision in this case is controlled by that in Gorham v. Massillon Iron & Steel Co., ante, p. 606.

Matz, Fisher & Boyden and Victor Elting, for appellant; Victor Elting and Walter L. Fisher of counsel.Amos C. Miller, for appellee. Mr. Justice McDonald

delivered the opinion of the court.
